column2: Staff of Alteration
A rare, hard to obtain Staff imbued with the powers of Alteration.
Atronach (Familiar)
[Root.GetFirstName] has somehow tamed an atronach, a being formed from the energies of Oblivion.
Auriel's Bow

Auriel's Bow is an artifact created and used by the Elven god Auriel, an aspect of the Imperial Akatosh, the Dragon God of Time. Although it takes the form of a modest Elven Moonstone bow, it is one of the most powerful weapons in Tamriel.
Auriel's Shield
Is of Orgnum's Blood or has not previously had the Coffer within the past 25 years.

Auriel's Shield is an artifact created and used by the Elven god Auriel, an aspect of the Imperial Akatosh, the Dragon God of Time. It takes the form of a small shield, sometimes rounded, made from either ebony or moonstone. It has several magickal abilities that help to make its wielder nigh invulnerable.
Azura's Star

Azura's Star is a Daedric artifact created by the Daedric Prince Azura. In appearance it looks like a large, intricately designed throwing star. In the right hands, Azura's Star acts as a reusable soul gem of almost unlimited capacity. This makes it highly sought by mages and assassins.
Band of Arcane Sight
This ring is heavily enchanted with a variety of Mystic detection spells, allowing for partial mitigation of the effects of blindness.
The Emperor's Guide to Tamriel
Author: [event_target:gtt_author.GetDynName]\nA comprehensive text describing the histories and cultures of each of Tamriel's provinces.
The Improved Emperor's Guide to Tamriel

Author: Flaccus Terentius\nThe Improved Emperor's Guide to Tamriel is a 224-page illustrated guide written and illustrated by the Imperial scholar, Flaccus Terentius and commissioned in 2E 581. The prior Emperor's Guide to Tamriel forms the bulk of the work, with additional transcripts of the author's travels through Tamriel and various excerpts and notes from additional, relevant works procured in the various provinces of Tamriel.
Pocket Guide to the Empire, 1st Edition
Pocket Guide to the Empire, 2nd Edition
Pocket Guide to the Empire, 3rd Edition
Pocket Guide to the Empire, 4th Edition
Pocket Guide to the Empire, 5th Edition

Author: [event_target:pg1_author.GetDynName], on behalf of the Imperial Geographical Society\The Pocket Guide to the Empire was an attempt to popularise and update the older, and by then heavily outdated Improved Emperor's Guide to Tamriel. The texts are shorter than the predecessor manuals but the Guide accomplished its task, being widely distributed by the IGS across Tamriel and helping bring together the various peoples of Tamriel. Critics commenting on the Guide however claim it is little more than a piece of biased propaganda.

Author: [event_target:pg2_author.GetDynName], on behalf of the Imperial Geographical Society\nThe 2nd Edition of the popular Pocket Guide. Similarly to its predecessor, the 2nd Edition features informative, dense texts and pictorials of the various peoples and places of Tamriel. The 2nd Edition attempted to provide more information than the 1st Edition but according to critics it was still heavily biased toward the author's favoured peoples, depicting those of other cultures to be more primitive and backwards than the author's own. The so-called "Pocket" Guide 2nd Edition was also too large to comfortably fit a normal sized person's pockets...

Author: [event_target:pg3_author.GetDynName], on behalf of the Imperial Geographical Society\nThe 3rd Edition of the Pocket Guide would go on to be the most popular text released by the Imperial Geographical Society. The 3rd Edition returned to the roots of the 1st Edition by abridging much of the information of the second and updating it for a new generation. Much of the bias of the older Guides was replaced with a more optimistic view of the various cultures of Tamriel in a fairer manner. Some biases were of course still present, but critics viewed them more as the innocence and naivety of the author than intentional derogation of "lesser" peoples.

Author: [event_target:pg4_author.GetDynName], on behalf of the Imperial Geographical Society\nThe 4th Edition of the famous Pocket Guide, commissioned by the Imperial Geographical Society to replace the 3rd Edition. The 4th is generally considered to be rather "flat" as far as the Pocket Guides went, offering little new information although the illustrations and maps provided with the Guide were very popular with travellers.

Author: [event_target:pg5_author.GetDynName], on behalf of the Imperial Geographical Society\nThe 5th Edition of the famous Pocket Guide is considered to be the most complete and unbiased edition of the Guide to date. Brief but comprehensive, the Guide offered a remarkably unbiased view of the cultures, history and places of Tamriel though critics claimed that in the pursuit of fairness and fact much of the "flavour" and artistic penmanship of the prior Editions was lost.
ABCs for Barbarians
This illustrated guide to the Cyrodilic alphabet is a simple, easy-to-use tool for basic literacy. Its hand-drawn pictures are based on fauna, flora and other familiar sights from Morrowind.
Boethiah's Pillow Book
No words can describe what you see. Or what you think you see.
Chance's Folly

Chance's Folly is the story by Zylmoc Golge, about a talented but arrogant and underhanded thief's untimely demise. The thief, whose alter ego is known as Chance, attempts to ransack a Dunmer ancestral tomb with the aid of a Breton madman who acts as muscle while she picks the locks. Chance underestimates her partner as well as the tomb's defenses, perishing within - but not before bypassing innumerable locks and traps.
Father of the Niben

Composed by Florin Jaliil, this is a translation of the ancient Aldmeri Udhendra Nibenu, writings pertaining to the Aldmeri explorer Topal the Pilot and his expedition to find Old Ehlnofey. The book chronicles Topal's exploits, in particular his victory over a large, leathery-winged beast which he brought down through skillful use of the bow and arrow.
Fundaments of Alchemy

Alyandon Mathierry's introductory treatise on alchemy provides a concise, easy-to-understand summary of the core concepts of alchemical study, including the tools of the trade, sampling ingredients, and concocting simple potions.
Fall of the Snow Prince

Fall of the Snow Prince is a dramatic retelling of the ancient Battle of Moesring, as transcribed by Lokheim, chronicler to chieftain Ingjaldr White-Eye. This book is particularly germane for its account regarding the titular character, a charismatic Falmer leader who valiantly led his people in an ill-fated final stand against the Atmoran invaders and was buried by his foes with dignity and reverence.
Liminal Bridges

Written by Camilonwe of Alinor, this scholarly text provides theoretical and practical information pertaining to transportation between Mundus and Oblivion, backed up with additional documentation. Of particular note is its summary of how to open a gate to Oblivion through the use of a sigil stone.
Hanging Gardens of Wasten Coridale
Although it appears to be little more than a simple travelogue, this book is written in Aldmeris and Dwemeris, presenting readers with a treasure trove of ancient linguistic and literary techniques.
Nchunak's Fire and Faith

Allegedly a translation of the adventures of the traveler Nchunak, this text depicts the cultural and philosophical values of the Dwemer who lived during the time of Kagrenac, including some contemporary Dwemer viewpoints on Kagrenac's theories.
N'Gasta! Kvata! Kvakis!
Authored by the Sload necromancer N'Gasta, this esoteric tome contains a bevy of magickal knowledge that can only truly be understood by one capable of speaking the difficult Sload language.
Notes on Racial Phylogeny

This treatise, compiled by the Arcane University's Council of Healers, examines some of the biological differences between various races of Tamriel, their reproductive compatibilities and incompatibilities, and the nature of "race," all through a scholarly lens.
Rislav the Righteous

Written by Sinjin, this is a retrospective biography on the life of Rislav Larich, King of Skingrad during the First Era. Rislav the Righteous details the Colovian monarch's rise to power, his political dealings, and his shocking victory against the forces of the Alessian Empire. Details within the book include an analysis of First Era Colovian military equipment and tactics.
Smithing - A Worthy Endeavor

Cuinaamo's treatise on smithing focuses on the mental side of proper smithing, looking less at the mechanical techniques required to forge arms and armor, and instead at the proper mindset that a reader should purportedly have in order to succeed in crafting equipment. The book likens smithing to studying magic, instructing the reader to stay positive and determined on the path to mastering their craft.
Strakes and Futtocks

This short guide by shipwright Curly Lainlyn contains concise instructions on the correct way to construct a seaworthy vessel. It stresses a standardized methodology for shipbuilding, and explains the purposes behind such techniques as rabbeting timber and cutting lumber from angled trunks to utilize their natural curvature.
The Buying Game

This trade manual from Adabael Timsar-Dadisun describes commerce as a game that "everyone can win" and includes suggestions with how to interface with merchants - what to look for, what to say, and knowing the right circumstances for making a purchase.
The Lusty Argonian Maid

Laden with innuendo and double-entendre, this bawdy play from Crassus Curio relates the sexual adventures of a privileged nobleman and his Argonian maidservant, and their effort to hide their romance from the noble's jealous wife.
Wulfmare's Guide to Better Thieving

Although the self-proclaimed accomplishments of the apparent author Wulfmare are impossible to verify, the Guide to Better Thieving reflects significant understanding in how to commit acts of subversion. The fundamentals of pickpocketing and lockpicking, two core thieving skillsets, are thoroughly described.
Gods and Worship in Tamriel

This is an introductory guide to Tamrielic theology and spirituality, written by Brother Hetchfield of the Imperial University. Positing several hypotheses on the nature of Tamriel's deities, it does not assert any one as being any more valid than any other, possibly to help the reader reach their own conclusion.
Remanada

Remanada is the mythological retelling of the rise of Reman - the hero who defeated the Akaviri invasion of Tamriel established the Cyrodilic Empire - and the chaos that ensued following the collapse of his dynasty.
Spirit of Nirn

This short text explains the religious importance of Lorkhan and the fundamental disagreements resulting from his involvement in the creation of the mortal plane. In addition, the book explores competing hypotheses as to the purpose of Nirn itself.
Song of the Askelde Men

A traditional Nordic poem, Song of the Askelde Men tells the story of a wistful ghost's attempt at vengeance against the men responsible for its death - through the ghost's own perspective. Although a work of fiction, it almost certainly provides valuable insight into Nordic funerary rites and beliefs about the dead.
Withershins

This tale by Yaqut Tawashi features a distressed Argonian tailor by the name of Zaki, who is positive that all of his conversations flow in alphabetical order. He consults a peculiar healer who, with a zoetrope and some magickal incantations, cures the bizarre ailment - with the added side effect of speaking words in reverse order and causing Zaki to walk backwards.
Colovian Badger
This ill-tempered creature is more than a handful to take care of, but is ferocious and quite a menace to anyone who dares threaten its owner.
Black Hands Dagger
The Black Hands Dagger is a minor artifact favoured by assassins.
Black Star
The Black Star is a corrupted form of Azura's Star capable of containing the souls of sentient beings such as Man and Mer.
Jagged Crown
The Jagged Crown is a unique helm and ancient relic that has served as a symbol of leadership and power for kings and queens of Skyrim since the First Era.
Blade of Woe
The Blade of Woe is an old assassin's blade with a feared reputation, most often found in the hands of a favoured member of the Dark Brotherhood.
Bodyguard (Familiar)
A heavy set, intimidating and often heavily armed individual can always be found in the presence of [Root.GetFirstName], rarely more than a few feet away.
Boots of Silence
These enchanted boots are a highly sought after prize for any thief or shady character.
Bow of Shadows

Legend has it that the Bow of Shadows was forged by the Daedra Nocturnal. The legendary ranger, Raerlas Ghile, was granted the Bow for a secret mission that failed, and the Bow was lost. Raerlas did not go down without a hearty fight and is said to have, with the aid of the Bow, taken scores of his foes with him.
Cat
A cat has deigned to grant this individual its company, for which said individual is likely very excited.
Chrysamere
Chrysamere, the Paladin's Blade and Sword of Heroes, is an ancient claymore with offensive capabilities only surpassed by its defences.
Clutterbane
Everything Must Go!
Staff of Conjuration
A rare, hard to obtain Staff imbued with the powers of Conjuration.
The Marsh Crown
The Marsh Crown is the symbol of power for the Kingdom of Argonia, or Black Marsh.
Crown of Lilmoth
The traditional symbol of power for the Kingdom of Lilmoth
Helm of the High King (Crown)

The Helm of the High King is said to have been worn by Ysgramor himself during his battles and the original formation of Skyrim. It has long since served as the Crown of the King, and is an important symbol of office.
Crown of Souls (Crown)
The Crown of Restful Souls is the traditional symbol of power for the Kingdom of Soulrest.
Crown of Storms (Crown)
The Crown of Storms is the traditional symbol of power for the Kingdom of Soulrest.
Crown of Thorns (Crown)
The Crown of Thorns is the traditional symbol of power for the Kingdom of Thorn.
Crown of Valenwood (Crown)
This is the Crown of Valenwood, the symbol of the wood-King and his authority.
Daedric Crescent
Probably the most rare and even outlawed item of all the great prizes is the Daedric Crescent Blade. The Blade was used by Mehrunes Dagon's Daedric forces in the capture of the Imperial Battlespire.
Dawnbreaker
Dawnbreaker is a powerful sword granted by the Daedric Prince Meridia who aid her in ridding the world of the undead, whom she abhors for their lack of living energy.
Blade of Edge
A black and red blade covered in needless spikes. It's so sharp you need protective equipment just to wield it.
Staff of Destruction
A rare, hard to obtain Staff imbued with the powers of Destruction.
Hound (Familiar)
[Root.GetFirstName] has earned the loyalty of a hound, and the beast can never be found far from their side.
Dragonbone Armour
This suit of armour is one of the greatest artifacts any collector or hero could own, it is constructed of real dragon bone. It is a truly exquisite piece of work and many have sought to possess it.
Dragonbones
This odd collection of bones apparently once belonged to a Dragon.
Ornamental Dragonclaw
An ornamental dragonclaw, a relic of a bygone era in Skyrim's history. Its exact use is unknown.
Banner of House Dres

This old, dusty Banner was, according to the legends of House Dres, carried by a victorious ancestor during the Four-Score War. It has since taken on symbolic importance within the House itself, and is, or was, present at all official functions and events.
Skin of the Lizard-King

This dried, fragile skin once adorned the bones of an Argonian Warchief who sought to rally his people against the incursions of the dark-skinned Dunmer. His 'rebellion' ended with a crushing defeat, and the Slavemasters of House Dres made an example of him, removing his skin via magickal, albeit no less painful, means before his assembled Army, now in chains. The Skin has since adorned the walls of House Dres's Family Keep, overlooking the throne of the House Elder.
Founder's Shield
A simple shield of common Dunmer design. It is said to be the last surviving artifact of the original founder of House Dres and is an important artifact to the House.
Harrada Vinewhip

A sinister looking, barbed whip fashioned from an enchanted Harrada Root. Some of the original plants 'life' still flows through the whip, waving back and forth like a snake, coiling about its victim's necks. This unique weapon is an artifact originally belonging to House Dres of Morrowind, and was apparently a constant companion of one of the first Dres slave-masters.
Dwarven Armour
A Suit of Dwarven Armour, likely recovered deep from within some Dwemer ruins.
Dwarven Weapon
An rather basic weapon of Dwarven design, likely recovered from Dwemer ruins.
Dwemer Puzzle Cube

A Dwemer Puzzle Cube, a rather complex invention of the dwarves. No one is quite sure of its true purpose any more, perhaps it was a child's toy, or a key of some kind? Whatever the case, it certainly brightens up any boring afternoon at court.
Dwemer Schematics

A collection of translated Dwemeri schematics, blueprints, and build plans recovered from an ancient ruin. These texts will provide us with great insight on engineering and construction techniques from the lost Deep Folk.
Easter Egg
This is an Easter Egg. It does absolutely nothing.
Ebony Mail

The Ebony Mail is a Daedric artifact created by the Daedric Prince Boethiah. In appearance it looks like a simple ebony cuirass. It can either be medium or heavy in weight. The artifact grants its wearer resistance to fire and magickal attacks, magickal protection from physical blows, quieter movements and the ability to poison enemies who get too close.
Ebony Armour
A rare suit of Ebony Armour.
Ebony Weapon
A rare, masterwork Ebony Weapon.
Ebony Blade

The Ebony Blade, sometimes called the Vampire or the Leech, resembles an ebony katana, and its power is very dark indeed. Every time the Ebony Blade strikes an opponent, part of the damage inflicted flows into the wielder as raw power. The Blade itself may not be any more evil than those who have used it, but at some point in its history, a charm was cast on it so it would not remain with any one individual for long. The wizard who cast this charm sought to save the souls of any too infatuated by the Blade, and perhaps he was right to do so.
Elder Scroll

The eponymous Elder Scrolls are artifacts of unknown origin and quantity, being simultaneously archives of both historic and future events. Those with the gift of prescience or divination are able to read from the Scrolls, but they risk suffering the "price" of doing so.
Eleidon's Ward

Eleidon was a holy knight of legend in Breton history. He was a sought after man for his courage and determination to set all wrongs right. In one story, it is said that he rescued a Baron's daughter from sure death at the hands of an evil warlord. For his reward, the Baron spent all of his riches to have an enchanted shield built for Eleidon.
Elven Armour
A set of rare, gilded Elven Armour. What sets this suit of armour apart from standard Elven Armour isn't its capabilities, but rather the intricate gilding and engravings adorning its surface.
Elven Weapon
An intricately engraved, masterwork example of Elven craftsmanship.
Declaration of the Empire
This cylinder contains the original document declaring the formation of the Empire of Tamriel, drafted by the Elder Council and signed by the first Emperor themself.
Fists of Randagulf

Randagulf of Clan Begalin goes down in Tamrielic history as one of the mightiest warriors from Skyrim. He was known for his courage and ferocity in battle and was a factor in many battles. He finally met his fate when King Harald conquered Skyrim. King Harald respected this great hero and took Randagulf's gauntlets for his own. After King Harald died, the gauntlets disappeared.
Glass Armour
A rare suit of Glass Armour, amongst the finest craftswork available in all of Nirn.
Glass Bow
A rare Glass Bow, amongst the finest craftswork available in all of Nirn.
Glass Weapon
A rare Glass Weapon, amongst the finest craftswork available in all of Nirn.
Goldbrand

The Goldbrand is an ancient artifact, which takes the form of a golden katana. It was created by the dragons of the North. According to the legends of thieves, it was given to a great knight who was sworn to protect the dragons. It contains the power of the Daedric Prince Boethiah, and burns those that it strikes.
Pirate King's Cutlass
A minor artifact of some ill-repute, this Cutlass apparently belonged to a mythical Pirate King of the Gold Coast who terrorised the entire western coast of Tamriel centuries ago.
Staff of Hasedoki

Hasedoki was said to have been a very competitive wizard. He wandered the land in search of a wizard who was greater than he. To the best of all knowledge, he never found a wizard was up to the challenge. It is said that he felt so lonely and isolated because so many feared his power, that he bonded his life-force into his very own staff, where his soul remains to this very day.
Fang of Haynekhtnamet

Black Marsh was once known to be inhabited with what the Argonians called the Wamasus. Northern men considered them to be intelligent dragons with lightning for blood. One such mighty beast, Haynekhtnamet, was slain by the Northern men, though it took 7 days and nights, and a score of men. One of the surviving men took a fang home as a trophy. The fang was carved down into a blade and fashioned into a small dagger. The Dagger mysteriously houses some of the beast's magickal properties
Hellfire Staff
A powerfully enchanted Staff, the Hellfire Staff is a favourite of battlemages and wizards alike.
Helm of Oreyn Bearclaw

The Helm of Oreyn Bearclaw is a prized artifact which once belonged to the legendary eponymous Hunter from Valenwood. The helm itself is an enchanted skull, which is said to improve the wearer's endurance.
Herder's Crook
It is said this crook was once owned by a Shepard-King and was used to keep not only his flock, but also his tribe in order.
Hircine's Ring
This small, silver ring bears the head of wolf and little other decoration. It is rumoured to be of Hircine's creation, allowing an individual cursed with lycanthropy to control their disease.
Final Point

When all negotiations have failed, there's also the knife. The Final Point is an ancient enchanted dagger that has been within House Hlaalu for generations, while it now serves as little more than a ceremonial tool, a symbol of the Grandmaster, it is still a potent and dangerous weapon.
Set of Hlaalu Ledgers

This set of overly large business ledgers contains the numerous contracts & agreements signed between members of House Hlaalu and its wide and varied trading partners. While much of the information is ancient and no longer applicable to the current day, the set is revered as a relic of the ancestors and is a symbol of the house.
Hlaalu Signet Ring

An important symbol of the House Hlaalu, the Signet Ring is how the Grandmaster puts his mark to contracts and forms them into legally binding agreements. It is an important and cherished family heirloom.
Ancestor Skull
It is so told amongst House Hlaalu that this Skull belonged to an ancient ancestor of the House, and it is revered with almost religious awe within the House.
Horse (Familiar)
A thoroughbred, strong mount perfect for racing or pleasure.
Iceblade of the Monarch

The Ice Blade of the Monarch is truly one of Tamriel's most prized artifacts. Legend has it that the Evil Archmage Almion Celmo enchanted the claymore of a great warrior with the soul of a Frost Monarch, a stronger form of the more common Frost Atronach.
Staff of Illusion
A rare, hard to obtain Staff imbued with the powers of Illusion.
Crown of Indoril

This ornate, gem-adorned Crown is considered one of the most important symbols of House Indoril, and their royal authority. Although not actually worn by Nerevar himself, the crown is strongly associated with him and his descendents.
Moon-and-Star

Moon-and-Star is an enchanted ring which once belonging to Lord Indoril Nerevar. The ring lent Nerevar supernatural powers of persuasion and indisputable proof of identity, since any other who tried to wear it would be killed instantly.
Shield of the High King
This seemingly ordinary Shield was apparently looted from the Corpse of a High King of Skyrim during the with Morrowind. It is a relic, or perhaps a more apt term would be a trophy of House Indoril.
Sword of Indoril
This ornate sabre was the side-arm of Nerevar himself, and was recovered after his death by his kin. It now serves as a powerful relic of the Archpraetor, the head of House Indoril.
Keening
Keening, along with Sunder and Wraithguard, comprise Kagrenac's Tools, which were essential to accessing the Heart of Lorkhan in Red Mountain.
Law Dog
Law Dog can fire a total of about 556 shots, the equivalent of 112 reloads, from full condition before breaking.
Armour of Morihaus

The Lord's Mail, sometimes called the Armour of Morihaus or the gift of Kynareth, is an ancient cuirass of unsurpassed quality. It is said when Kynareth deigns the warrior unworthy, it will vanish and await the next worthy individual.
Mace of Molag Bal

The Mace of Molag Bal, also known as the Vampire's Mace, is one of Molag Bal's artifacts. It is a particular punishing weapon that tears the souls and magickal energies from its victims as they die beneath its crushing blows.
Magebane
This seemingly ordinary Glass sword is actually a powerfully enchanted weapon popular, as the name suggests, for smiting those arcanely-inclined.
Mantella

The Mantella is a massive green gem created from the soul of the Underking, that serves as the heart of the Numidium, a gigantic brass golem. The Mantella must be placed into the body of the Numidium in order to resurrect it.
Masque of Clavicus Vile
Ever the vain one, Clavicus Vile made a masque suited to his own personality. The bearer of the masque is more likely to get a positive response from the people of Tamriel.
Mimir (Familiar)
A floating, talking skull. You are somewhat curious as to how he is able to float around. "Is Annah still wearing clothes?"
Monkey
[Root.GetFirstName] has somehow managed to procure a trained monkey, a very rare and exotic pet.
Oghma Infinium

The Oghma Infinium is a very powerful Daedric artifact of the Daedric Prince Hermaeus Mora. It is a tome of knowledge written by Xarxes, the wizard sage known also as "The Ageless One," the Scribe of Auri-El. Knowledge within the tome grants the reader access to the artifact's energy which can be manipulated to achieve near demi-god abilities.
Orcish Weapon
A brutal looking weapon fashioned in the Orcish style from their favoured mineral, Orichalcum.
Crown of Orsinium (Crown)
This jagged, spiked helm serves as the Crown of Orsinium, the Orsimer Kingdom.
Orgnum's Coffer

[GetOrgnumKingQueen] Orgnum's Coffer is a small-sized chest, ordinary in appearance. It is remarkably light, almost weightless, which offers a clue to its true magick. Once a day, the Coffer will create gold from naught. When [GetOrgnumKingQueen] Orgnum [GetOrgnumHerHim]self possessed the Coffer, the supply within was limitless.
Raven

“Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered, weak and weary,
Over many a quaint and curious volume of forgotten lore,
While I nodded, nearly napping, suddenly there came a tapping,
As of some one gently rapping, rapping at my chamber door."
Redoran Banner Shield
The Redoran Banner Shield is the symbol of the head of House Redoran, and a revered artifact.
Redas Chalice
This fairly ordinary looking chalice is a prized family heirloom of House Redoran. It holds little intrinsic value to others, except as a trophy or collector's item.
Helm of the Founder
This helmet is one of the last remaining pieces of the founder of House Redoran's suit of armour. It is a prized symbol of their house.
Robe of Deeds
This extravagant ceremonial robe is an important and prized family heirloom of House Redoran.
Redas Waraxe
The Redas Waraxe is a prized family heirloom of House Redoran.
Staff of Restoration
A rare, hard to obtain Staff imbued with the powers of the School of Restoration.
Ring of the Khajiit

The Ring of the Khajiit is an ancient relic, hundreds of years older than Rajhin, the thief who made the Ring famous. It was Rajhin who used the Ring's powers to make himself as invisible, silent, and quick as a breath of wind. Using the Ring he became the most successful burglar in Elsweyr's history. Rajhin's eventual fate is a mystery, but according to legend, the Ring rebelled against such constant use and disappeared, leaving Rajhin helpless before his enemies...
Ring of Namira
Namira is aligned with the darker side of nature, as is her ring.
Ring of Phynaster

The Ring of Phynaster was made hundreds of years ago by a person who needed good defences to survive his adventurous life. Thanks to the Ring, Phynaster lived for hundreds of years, and since then it has passed from person to person.
Sanguine Rose

The Sanguine Rose is a Daedric artifact created by the Daedric Prince Sanguine. It can take on many forms, including that of an actual rose, a wooden stave carved like a rose and a staff-sized rose. Although powerful, the Rose is not an artifact most would care to possess. It can be used to summon a lesser daedra, who will attack all except the holder. Each time the Rose is used it wilts a little, and when all the petals fall off, it loses its power.
Saviour's Hide

Legend has it that Hircine rewarded his peeled hide to the first and only mortal to have ever escaped his hunting grounds. This unknown mortal had the hide tailored into this magickal cuirass for his future adventures. The Saviour's Hide has a tendency to travel from hero to hero as though it has a mind of its own.
Scamp

[Root.GetFirstName] seems to somehow have made a Scamp his personal familiar, a very odd occurrence as most Daedra, even the lesser forms, are generally only able to remain in Nirn for a short period of time, unless the barriers are broken...
Scourge

The Daedric Scourge is a mighty mace forged from sacred ebony in the Fires of Fickledire. The legendary weapon of Mackkan, it was once a fierce weapon used to send spirits of black back into Oblivion.
Shimsil
An enchanted ebony short sword. While not particularly famous, it is still a highly sought after item by the more shadow-bound adventurers and individuals.
Silver Sword

A rare weapon forged from the finest steel, inlaid with pure silver. It is said Silver is the only material able to harm the undead and creatures of magick, but in general this weapon is more a show-piece than a battle-ready side-arm due to its weaker, more fanciful construction.
Superior Silver Sword

A rare weapon forged from the finest steel, inlaid with pure silver. It is said Silver is the only material able to harm the undead and creatures of magick, but in general this weapon is more a show-piece than a battle-ready side-arm due to its weaker, more fanciful construction.
Flawless Silver Sword

A rare weapon forged from the finest steel, inlaid with pure silver. It is said Silver is the only material able to harm the undead and creatures of magick, but in general this weapon is more a show-piece than a battle-ready side-arm due to its weaker, more fanciful construction.
Skeever

A disgusting, large rat like beast. The Skeever, like its smaller cousins, is generally considered a pest, and is known for spreading disease and sickness. One doesn't usually keep them as pets but...well some people are just weird.
Skeleton Key
The merchants of Cyrodiil would sleep more soundly, knowing this Key is gone from the world. But why tell them?
Skull Crusher

The Skull Crusher is an amazingly large, and powerful weapon. The warhammer was created in a fire, magickally fuelled by the Wizard, Dorach Gusal, and was forged by the great weaponsmith, Hilbongard Rolamus.
Skull of Corruption
What a foul and unnatural weapon you wield, I've never seen its like.
Snake

The Umbra Sword was a Daedric artifact designed with the sole purpose of the entrapment of souls. The ancient witch Naenra Waerr created the sword at the request of Clavicus Vile, who wanted the sword as a tool of mischief which would send him souls from the mortal realm. Naenra created the sword, but it was unstable. Vile gave the witch a piece of his power to be imbued in the sword, which stabilised the weapon. However, Naenra supposedly tricked him, as the piece of Vile's power imbued in the sword became a sentient being which called itself Umbra. Naenra was executed for her evil creation, but not before she hid the sword. The sword took on a life of its own, remaining hidden until a worthy wielder was found. Umbra would then slowly take control of the wielder. The Umbra Sword had the ability to change shape, but it was always in the form of a bladed weapon. It has been reported as a black and silver claymore, a jet black longsword and as a black sword emblazoned with red markings.

Wuuthrad

Wuuthrad, meaning "Storm's Tears" in the language of Atmora, was the legendary battleaxe wielded by Ysgramor during his conquest of Skyrim in the late Merethic Era. With Wuuthrad in his hands, Ysgramor and his Five Hundred Companions slaughtered an untold number of elves, which culminated in the founding of the First Empire of the Nords. For the Companions, Wuuthrad is a sacred relic which holds a great deal of respect and reverence, and through it they can trace their line straight back to the first Harbinger\n[Courtesy of UESP]
